item.title: Anonymous: Comment 1
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description: Great stuff, but which bridge port will be used by default? 443? Remember that Skype on windows uses 443, 80 ports for relaying.

item.title: arma: Comment 2
item.dcterms:creator: arma
item.description:
Vidalia picks port 443 by default on Windows, and port 9001 by default on OS X and Linux (since in those cases it can't pick a privileged port without permissions).

You can go into the Vidalia "sharing" settings window and change the port. But that defeats some of the point of a preconfigured bundle. I wonder how much of an issue this conflict is in practice.

item.title: Anonymous: Comment 3
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description: Yes arma, i wonder too, because most of end non-advanced users are using Skype, without ticking out "User 80,443 ports for connections" box in Skype settings. This realy breaks "just Setup&Use" mode.
